Ensure that the end point of `line_1` connects to the start point of `line_2`, and so on for all the lines to form a closed loop. 3. The loop should form a shape similar to a rectangle with half-circle extensions at both ends along the X-axis. Once the 2D sketch is ready, extrude it with the following properties: * Depth towards normal: 0.075 units * Operation: NewBodyFeatureOperation Part 2: Construct a smaller rectangular prism on top of the first prism. Create a new coordinate system with the following transformation: * Euler Angles: (0°, 0°, -90°) * Translation Vector: (0.1875, 0.3375, 0) Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane with the following features: 1. Create a closed loop with 7 line segments, listed as `line_1` to `line_7` under `face_1` and `loop_1` in the sketch object. 2. Ensure that the end point of `line_1` connects to the start point of `line_2`, and so on for all the lines to form a closed loop. 3. The loop should form a shape similar to a rectangle with half-circle extensions at both ends along the X-axis and a height equivalent to half the length of the X dimension. Extrude the 2D sketch with the following properties: * Depth towards normal: 0.2625 units * Operation: JoinFeatureOperation Part 3: Construct a half-pyramid-shaped structure. Create a new coordinate system with the following transformation: * Euler Angles: (0°, 0°, -90°) * Translation Vector: (0.2813, 0.2625, 0.3281) Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane with the following features: 1. Create a closed loop with 4 line segments, listed as `line_1` to `line_4` under `face_1` and `loop_1` in the sketch object. 2. prompt: <description>Part 1: A Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom The first part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The length and width of the prism are equal, while the height is half the width. Here are the detailed instructions for constructing this part: 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** Use the following parameters for the coordinate system: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.001, 0.0, 0.0] 2. **Draw the first face of the prism.** On the XY plane of the new coordinate system, draw a closed loop with the following curves: * Arc 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0117], Mid Point [0.0, 0.0039], End Point [0.0068, 0.0] * Line 1: Start Point [0.0068, 0.0], End Point [0.136, 0.0] * Arc 2: Start Point [0.136, 0.0], Mid Point [0.1427, 0.0039], End Point [0.1427, 0.0117] * Line 2: Start Point [0.1427, 0.0117], End Point [0.0781, 0.1236] * Arc 3: Start Point [0.0781, 0.1236], Mid Point [0.0714, 0.1275], End Point [0.0646, 0.1236] * Line 3: Start Point [0.0646, 0.1236], End Point [0.0, 0.0117] This face represents the bottom of the prism. 3. **Scale the sketch.** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1427. 4. **Extrude the sketch into 3D.** Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by 0.75 units and in the opposite direction by 0 units. This will create the prism shape. Here is a summary of the dimensions of Part 1: * Length: 0.1427 units * Width: 0.1427 units * Height: 0.75 units Note that the origin of the coordinate system is not at the center of the prism, but slightly offset by (0.001, 0, 0). This is to avoid potential issues when creating the subsequent parts in the CAD assembly.</description>

This part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners.</description>
